summary: The Veterans Community Care Program, established in 2019, allows eligible veterans to receive care from non-VA health care providers. The VA excludes providers from participating in the program who have been disciplined for poor quality care. But VA's processes may not prevent excluded providers from participating. For example, the VA may not always verify whether providers have lost licenses over care quality. Also, while the...
title: Veterans Community Care Program: Immediate Actions Needed to Ensure Health Providers Associated with Poor Quality Care Are Excluded
